name: CmR
description: Versus ad repetendum for the communion

name: D
description: Dramatic element (used for items of liturgical drama that are not otherwise rubricked)

name: [G]
description: Mass chant (a generic code used in the earliest Cantus indices)

name: [GV]
description: Verse for a Mass chant (a generic code used in the earliest Cantus indices)

name: InR
description: Versus ad repetendum for the introit

name: IP
description: Invitatory psalm (when fully written out and notated)

name: L
description: Lesson (when fully written out and notated)

name: [M]
description: "Miscellaneous" (a descriptor used in the earliest versions of Cantus for the Te Deum, Versus in Triduo, prosulae - to be replaced by Va=Varia)

name: [MO]
description: Mass Ordinary  (a generic code used in the earliest Cantus indices)
